details.description: Register with the Care Quality Commission (CQC) if you run an adult placement service in England
details.licence_short_description: Register with the Care Quality Commission if you run a business in England that offers an adult placement service.
details.licence_overview:
Register with the Care Quality Commission (CQC) if you run an adult placement service in England.

You must register as a ‘service provider’ - which can be an organisation, a partnership or an individual.

If you’re registering as an individual, but you don’t intend to be in charge full-time yourself, you must also register a manager.

Download ‘Registered Manager application form’ (DOC, 402KB)

Conditions

You need to provide your Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) disclosure number as part of your application. You can’t complete the application form until you have the green copy of your CRB certificate.

You need to have CRB disclosure numbers for:

  • the providers of the service (whether these are partners or an individual)
  • the registered manager

You can get your CRB check through CQC.

You will also have to:

  • make a declaration that you are medically fit to carry out the role you’re registering for
  • provide details for your doctor and your last employer

How to apply

Application forms for each type of provider (organisation, partnership or individual) are available from CQC.

You will need to:

  • provide details of each location you will provide adult placement services from
  • list the regulated activities you will carry out
  • meet essential standards of quality and safety
  • make a ‘declaration of compliance’

CQC will check your application for missing documents or information. They will send you a confirmation letter to tell you when this is done.

If CQC agree to your registration, they will send you a ‘Notice of decision’ to tell you. If they decide not to register you, they will send you a ‘Notice of proposal’ to tell you why.

Fee

There is no application fee, but there is an annual fee that covers registration, monitoring and any changes to your registration during the year. You’ll get an invoice for the fee once you’re registered.

Fines and penalties

If you carry out a regulated activity without being registered with CQC, you will be committing an offence. You can be fined and imprisoned.
